extension.description: This is a proof of concept build based on MAME 0.78.[CR][CR]MAME stands for [B]M[/B]ultiple [B]A[/B]rcade [B]M[/B]achine [B]E[/B]mulator. When used in conjunction with images of the original arcade game's ROM and disk data, MAME attempts to reproduce that game as faithfully as possible on a more modern general-purpose computer. MAME can currently emulate several thousand different classic arcade video games from the late 1970s through the modern era.[CR][CR]Source: https://github.com/libretro/mame078-libretro
